alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 05 at 6:46PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: .Water levels on the Mendenhall are continuing to rise. Record flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Record flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...The Mendenhall Lake and River around the glacier visitor center, the Mendenhall campground, Skaters Cabin Road, View Drive and below Back Loop bridge. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Record high flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations near Mendenhall Lake and River is occurring. Flooding is starting to be reported in areas that have not previously seen flooding before. Significant bank erosion is also occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 617 PM AKDT, Water levels on Mendenhall Lake have reached 13.9 feet which is approaching the Major flood stage of 14.0 feet. This is also now well above the previous record high stage recorded back in 2016 of 12.0 feet. Water levels continue to rise with a rate of rise of around 0.3 feet per hour. Flooding is now being reported in areas that have not previously seen flooding before and significant bank erosion has been observed as well. - For Mendenhall Lake : At 6:15pm the stage was 13.9 feet. Major Flood Stage is 14.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 14.5 feet is now expected around 8:00pm Saturday. This forecast is highly uncertain as it is unknown how much water is left to release from Suicide Basin. This will be a new all time record high stage for the Mendenhall Lake. Impacts: At 10.9 feet: View Drive will be flooded and impassable with significant flooding to some homes in the area. Locations below back loop bridge will begin to see flooding of some yards, significant bank erosion along with hazardous navigation from debris in the river. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - If you live near or along the Mendenhall River, stay alert and be prepared to take action. - Mariners should be aware of additional debris in the water.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
